caption: Attended a party there and had a wonderful experience. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. The staff was attentive, efficient and very professional. We’ll be back!

Very nice restaurant in Chatou. It has a beautiful view over the river and the restaurant is a patrimonial building with old drawings on the walls. The food was very delicious specially the ombrine fish . They have a list of allergens. The wine was excellent as well as the service. I recommend on hot summer days. Plenty of parking spaces nearby.

What a wonderful place, full of meaning for art history. 1881, Pierre Auguste Renoir was inspired by this lovely place to create one of the most iconic pieces of art of our times… And here we are, almost 150 years later, lunching with the rowers.

We had a beautiful lunch for my Aunt's feast and the Manager and the Pastry Chef went above and beyond to offer us an unforgettable experience. Thank you from the bottom of the heart. Highly recommended!!
Nice view on the river, feels like in the country side. Service was very slow, it took us some 35 minutes just to order drinks. Average food, cannot say it was bad but nothing special.

Simply a wonderful experience! Luncheon of the Boating Party is my favourite piece of artwork and visiting Maison Fournaise lived up to, even surpassed, expectations. Wonderful location, fabulous food and lovely staff. I'm a Yorkshireman and even I didn't find the price too bad, we paid a fair price for... a simply wonderful experience! Merci

Lovely and historic building with a great view. The terrace is the location from a Renoir painting. Delicious food and excellent, friendly service. Thanks to our server for being patient with me practicing French!

An experience of a lifetime. Le Dejeuner des Canotiers has been our favourite Renoir painting for many, many years. Before we left North America, I arranged with the staff for us to be seated at The Table- the one in the foreground of the painting at which Aline Charigot is seated with her little dog, surrounded by the others- Gustave Caillebotte, Paul Lhote, Ellen André, Jeanne Samary, Alphonse fils and Alphonsine Fournaise, et al. On arrival we were indeed seated there and proceeded to have the best lunch ever. Food, atmosphere, and service were impeccable. At the end of the meal, I proposed to my girlfriend, and she accepted. I will never forget the kindness displayed to us by the wonderful staff. BTW you DO have to really want to eat here, as from Montmartre it's metro, then RER train, then about a 20-minute walk. BUT worth every second.
Outstanding food, attentive service in a historic local. Highly recommended!
The food and atmosphere was wonderful. How inspiring to be where Renoir painted such an incredible painting!

The food and wine is great and the place is very beautiful and inspiring. However, the service... We were first in and it wasn't completely filled while we were there, they might have had a party somewhere, but still. It was cold on the balcony, so waiting and waiting for ordering, dishes and being allowed to pay destroyed the experience, that we had been looking much forward too. Also, the bathroom was ill equiped throughout the evening.

A particular disappointment. We’d made a reservation. On being seated we had to wait 25 minutes to get a menu. We were then told that 7 out of 8 mains weren’t available, and 4 of 6 starters. The waitress shrugged when asked why. There was no apology or explanation. We left. It’s too expensive to suffer such poor service. Just across the river are cheaper restaurants which have the views and the service, and don’t suffer from the highway noise. I somehow doubt Renoir would be a patron today.

This was the worst restaurant experience I have ever had in France. I booked a reservation for lunch four days ahead and quickly received a confirmation from the restaurant. After I had left my hotel to make my way there, I received a last minute cancellation with no explanation why. This restaurant is where Renoir painted the Luncheon of the Boating Party which has been my favorite painting for more than forty years, so I decided to swallow my pride and I rebooked for dinner that evening. I showed up and there was no one downstairs to welcome guests and no directions of where to go. My reservation was for the same time that the restaurant opened. There was a large tour group milling about in the yard waiting to be seated, so I assumed that someone would appear to give directions, but no one ever did. I eventually made my own way upstairs and found a couple of waitstaff there who seated me right away. The first part of the meal was great. They served me a delicious complementary gazpacho, the asparagus was also delicious, and the 1664 beer was the best French beer I have had. The chicken was uninspired, but OK. I ordered another beer to have with the main dish. Meanwhile, I watched from the window as my waiter obsessively arranged, then rearranged, then rearranged again the tables and chairs on the terrace below, for more than forty-five minutes! This seemed odd, since the tour group had been seated inside and the main dining room was nearly empty, and no one was going to sit outside on this nippy evening. But my courses were being served by another waitress and I assumed that my service had been reassigned to her. So I waited for my beer for twenty minutes before reordering it. Then I waited another twenty-five minutes. By this time, I had long been finished with the main course and decided I would skip the beer and just order dessert and coffee, when suddenly my original waiter showed up with the beer that I had ordered forty-five minutes before! I explained to him that it was much too late and so I sent it back. He cleared my table and I expected him to return with the dessert menu, but he disappeared again. After another twenty=five minutes of being ignored, I decided to call it quits and I strolled out to get a better view of the balcony where Renoir painted his masterpiece. There was no staff around and I got the feeling that I could have walked out of the restaurant without anyone noticing until closing time. If you love Renoir's painting, I would recommend coming to the location to see it for yourself, but skip the restaurant.

The place is located on an island in the river. The location is nice, and the view is great. However, I’ve found the service very slow. It took them 45 minutes to serve the first dish. The quality of the food is OK, but you would expect something more for a place with this setup.

Beautiful evening with the loveliest staff. The setting is bucolique and charming, we ate on the terrasse it was delightful. The food was delicious with lots of attention to detail. The daurade was excellent! I highly recommend!

What a lovely place. Situated on the Ile des Impressionistes (Impressionists Island), you have beautiful views of the Seine. The food is really good. A well balanced menu offering some traditional french cuisine. All plates come through prepared to perfections. Delicious. The staff, especially the lady in the lead, is wonderful. Knowledgeable, kind, and able to handle your requests with grace.  This might very well become a favorite.
Superb location & food

A very charming, by-the-water restaurant. Loved the overall atmosphere. Friendly servers. Food flavors well-balanced. Had the asparagus for starters -- the green asperges were a bit fibrous but delicious nonetheless. Kids who dined got real fun cotton candy for dessert -- I actually envied them haha. Real great lunch experience!
Perfect quality of meal ever tasted and kind services in the most historical restaurant near Paris.

Historic restaurant to live the impressionist experience, side of the Seine River on an island in the middle of the river. Path to hike or bike on the sides of the river, a video museum about the life of the painter Renoir to visit. Reservation required, mandatory on weekends, menu at a fixed price available on weekdays. Food very good, prices inline with Paris. Exceptional view from the terrace tables.
Great food and lovely environment.

We are passing through Chatou on our boat and managed to secure a dinner reservation last minute. The restaurant has beautiful atmosphere, we sit on the balcony overlooking river Seine and both starter and main were delicious. Service was excellent and staff was very attentive, I had a fish dinner - Ombrine Ocellee, it was superb with coconut & lime. We enjoyed our dinner thoroughly and will recommend to other passing boaters and travelers.

A most wonderful restaurant, excellent food, attentive staff and the great atmosphere being at the centre of one of Pierre Auguste Renoir's most famous painings. The food and wine were perfect, the setting idyllic. Highly recommended for the perfect celebration.
Beautiful spot, great food, attentive staff - a must, especially if you like Impressionism

The setting is lovely beside the Seine. However the use of what is an outdoor space for indoor dining in winter requires better heating than what was available. One end of the dining area on the enclosed terrace has no direct heating and is full of drafts. On top of that the heating was turned off when the main area which had heaters got hot....which led to more cold and breezes at our far end. Supplying rugs is not good enough at all. We really regretted not asking to be moved given we were there early. The staff were charming. However we were served hot amuse bouche well in advance of our aperitif which wete mixed up and served to wrong persons. We suspect our main dushes got lost in transit for awhile. On the food side, the menu has a strange mix of dishes. There are two menus side by side with similar options, but why have two. We took a platter to share for four for starters which had plentiful ham and pickeled fish but only 2 slices of toast for 4. The mains were slow in coming even though we were first to arrive in the restaurant. The food which was tasty (fish, liver, pheasant) went cold fast on the plates given the breeze and coolness of our corner. In spite of being told the child's menu would be speeded through, she got served after we got our main course. Her chicken nuggets which were home made were not fully cooked in the middle. I would question a children's menu that serves tartare sauce with chicken nuggets. The coffee gourmand was ok but lacked a bit of panache as everything tasted similar. Unfortunately the cold took from our pleasure and the service could be better.
Lovely place, surrounded by trees and flowers. Qualified and highly professional staff. You are welcomed with courtesy and kindness. Delicious food and wines. A real moment of pleasure.
Didn't enjoy a single meal. The service is slow and lazy. The prices are too high. The place is not worth the hype.
Lovely ambiance, friendly service, delicious food.
Good friendly environment, excellent service and good food.
Food wasn’t amazing. My dessert had bad fruits (mold). But service was great.
Great location, peaceful place.  Some of the dishes ate exquisitely prepared, others are good enough
Great food and brilliant ambience! The gentleman waiting on us was very helpful and took really good care of us.
Really really good meal here, traditional French cooking and wines at their best.
Very good location and food but only customers in restaurant so no atmosphere
Very enjoyable place to visit. Good decor, Good service, Good food.
Nice restaurant with quality food in an interesting location.
Very good restaurant. I recommend.
Wonderful historical environment with excellent food.
